meanings.definition: A small, thin piece of wood or metal used to hold something in place.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a sprigtail to attach the pieces of the birdhouse together.
meanings.sent2: She found a sprigtail on the ground and used it to pin her drawing to the wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the sprigtail as a tiny sword in its imaginary battle.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a sprigtail, keeping her dreams firmly in place.
meanings.sent5: The sprigtail gleamed in the sunlight, a tiny but essential part of the structure.

meanings.definition: A small, thin piece of hair or plant.
meanings.sent1: The little girl proudly showed off the sprigtail of a daisy she had picked.
meanings.sent2: He carefully tucked the sprigtail of hair behind her ear, smiling warmly.
meanings.sent3: The sprigtail of grass peeking out from the sidewalk seemed to be waving hello.
meanings.sent4: Her sprigtail of hair danced in the breeze, adding to her carefree aura.
meanings.sent5: The sprigtail of ivy climbed the wall, adding a touch of nature to the room.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a sprigtail.
meanings.sent1: She tried to sprigtail the loose button back onto her coat.
meanings.sent2: The farmer would sprigtail the gate shut to keep the animals safe at night.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to sprigtail the kite string to the tree branch, but it kept slipping off.
meanings.sent4: The old lock was sprigtailed shut, keeping the treasure hidden inside.
meanings.sent5: With a quick motion, she sprigtailed the papers together, ready to hand them in.
